episode.title: The Great Pricing Debate — Hourly vs Flat vs Day Rate

rundown.label: Host Intro
script: Welcome to TattooNOW Weekly! I'm Gabe Ripley.
Tonight: The Great Pricing Debate. Three artists, three pricing models, one question — who's right?
We've got Marcus Rodriguez, Sarah Chen, and Devon Jackson going head to head.
Plus: clips from our best pricing moments, our Villain Arts Miami update, and a round of Who Tattooed It.
rundown.presenterNotes: Energy: excited but grounded. This is a debate episode — set the tone that this will be fun AND informative. Name each panelist with a beat between each.

rundown.label: Meet the Panelists
rundown.presenterNotes: Introduce each panelist one at a time. Show headshot + lower-third with name, style, and pricing model. Quick portfolio flash (2 images each) as they're introduced. Let each panelist wave/say hello.

rundown.label: Topic Primer: Pricing Psychology
rundown.presenterNotes: Set the stage before the debate. Go through the pricing slides so the audience (and panelists) have shared context. Ask panelists to hold reactions until after.

rundown.label: Panel Discussion — Part 1: Your Pricing Model
talkingPoints: What's your current pricing model and why?
When did you switch from hourly to your current model?
How do clients react to your pricing — any pushback?
rundown.presenterNotes: Go around the table for each question. Marcus first (project-based), then Sarah (hourly), then Devon (day rate). Encourage cross-talk after each round. Keep the debate friendly. Display panelist headshot lower-third when they're speaking.

rundown.label: Who Tattooed It? — Rounds 1 & 2
rundown.presenterNotes: Palate cleanser between debate halves. Panelists play along — they guess too. Keep it fast and fun. Save round 3 for the closing.

adSlots.script: If you're a tattoo artist looking to level up your business, check out TattooNOW — professional websites, booking systems, and marketing tools built for artists.

rundown.label: Best Pricing Moments — React
rundown.presenterNotes: Play 2 of the 3 clips (Marcus Johnson + Sarah Chen's clips). After each, ask the panelists to react. 'Do you agree?' 'Would you handle that differently?'

rundown.label: Panel Discussion — Part 2: Advice & Lightning Round
talkingPoints: What's the biggest pricing mistake you see other artists make?
If a new artist asked you how to price their first year, what would you say?
Lightning round: name your price for these 3 hypothetical pieces
rundown.presenterNotes: The lightning round is the most shareable moment. Show a mystery tattoo photo, each panelist has 10 seconds to quote a price. Display their answers side-by-side. Audience will love the differences. End with: 'Three artists, three models, all successful — that's the point.'

rundown.label: Who Tattooed It? — Final Round
rundown.presenterNotes: Final round only. Panelists all guess. Whoever gets it right gets bragging rights. Play it up — 'Last chance to prove you know your artists!'

rundown.label: Host Outro / CTA
script: That was incredible. Thank you to Marcus Rodriguez, Sarah Chen, and Devon Jackson for bringing the heat tonight.
If you took one thing away from this episode, let it be this: there is no one right way to price your work — but there IS a wrong way, and that's not thinking about it at all.
Audit your pricing this week. Compare to artists at your level. And if you're below average — raise it.
Don't forget: Villain Arts Miami is next weekend. Code TATTOONOW for 15% off.
Next week: we're heading to the convention floor. Live guests, artist spotlights, and surprises.
Follow us on Instagram at TattooNOW.
Thanks for watching — we'll see you next Thursday at 7!
rundown.presenterNotes: Warm, appreciative energy. Thank each panelist by name. The 'no one right way' line is the thesis — deliver it directly to camera. CTA into next week's convention episode should feel exciting.
